intro: Eriosema erici-rosenii, commonly known as the rose-rosescent eriosema, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its unique leaf structure. The plant features trifoliate leaves with hairy surfaces, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom during the warmer months. Eriosema erici-rosenii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
